clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of AMG 714 in Adult Patients With Celiac Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of AMG 714 in Adult Patients With Celiac Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Protocol CELIM-NRCD-001 is designed to be a Phase 2a, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of AMG 714 for the attenuation of the effects of gluten exposure in adult patients with celiac disease during a gluten challenge.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Attenuation of gluten-induced small intestinal mucosal injury as assessed by the change from baseline to Week 12 in Vh:Cd ratio
primary_outcome.description: The Vh:Cd is the morphometric measure of the length of the small intestinal villi with respect to the depth of the crypts

secondary_outcome.measure: Attenuation of gluten-induced small intestinal mucosal inflammation at Week 12 compared to baseline, as measured by the enumeration of intraepithelial lymphocytes (IELs) in histological sections
secondary_outcome.description: Small bowel biopsies will be processed and stained with hematoxylin-eosin stains, and the IELs counted per 100 epithelial cells.

secondary_outcome.measure: Attenuation of gluten-induced serum antibodies at Week 12 compared to baseline (anti-deamidated gliadin peptides, DGP) and autoantibodies (anti-transglutaminase, ATG)
secondary_outcome.description: DGP and ATG antibodies will be measured in serum by ELISA technique

secondary_outcome.measure: Attenuation at Week 12 compared to baseline, of gluten-induced clinical symptoms as measured by the Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Scale (GSRS)
secondary_outcome.description: The GSRS questionnaire will be filled at every visit (approximately monthly)

other_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of AMG 714 as assessed by the proportion of subjects with drug related adverse events
other_outcome.description: Adverse events and serious adverse events will be captured on an on-going basis from screening to study end.

arm_group.description: AMG 714 150 mg SC every two weeks
AMG 714 300 mg SC every two weeks

intervention.description: A fully human anti-IL-15 monoclonal antibody

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of celiac disease by intestinal biopsy at least 12 months prior to screening
- On a gluten-free diet for at least 12 months
- Negative celiac serology
- Avoidance of pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe complications of celiac disease, such as refractory celiac disease
- Celiac symptoms
- Other concomitant autoimmune disease
- Chronic, active GI disease
- Infections, concomitant diseases
- Prohibited medications
